intro: Cleome heratensis subsp. pakistanica, commonly known as the Pakistan cleome, is a flowering plant native to parts of South Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
